title: Drawing, "Project for the entrance wall of a salon with alternative suggestions", 1760–70
medium: Graphite, brush and rose and brown washes, black ink on oxydizing white paper
inscribed: Bottom center in pen and black ink: "Galerie D'Amphitrite."
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The left and right halves suggest different details. Three shallow niches. In the center is the folding door with a musical trophy as overdoor. At left: A fountain at the foot of a looking glass. At right: a fountain with two mermen and a flower vase. Boardering strip and line.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for the entrance wall of a salon with alternative suggestions", 1760–70.
1760–70. Graphite, brush and rose and brown washes, black ink on oxydizing white paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-44.
